title.text: Building the Syntactic Reference Corpus of Medieval French Using NotaBene RDF Annotation Tool

entities.text: Syntactic Reference Corpus of Medieval French

abstractContent.text: In this paper, we introduce the NotaBene RDF Annotation Tool free software used to build the Syntactic Reference Corpus of Medieval French.

entities.text: Syntactic Reference Corpus of Medieval French

abstractContent.text: It relies on a dependency-based model to manually annotate Old French texts from the Base de Français Médiéval and the Nouveau Corpus d'Amsterdam.

entities.text: Old French texts from the Base de Français Médiéval and the Nouveau Corpus d'Amsterdam

abstractContent.text: NotaBene uses OWL ontologies to frame the terminology used in the annotation, which is displayed in a tree-like view of the annotation.
This tree widget allows easy grouping and tagging of words and structures.

entities.text: grouping and tagging of words and structures

abstractContent.text: To increase the quality of the annotation, two annotators work independently on the same texts at the same time and NotaBene can also generate automatic comparisons between both analyses.

The RDF format can be used to export the data to several other formats: namely, TigerXML (for querying the data and extracting structures) and graphviz dot format (for quoting syntactic description in research papers).
First, we will present the Syntactic Reference Corpus of Medieval French project (SRCMF) (1).

entities.text: Syntactic Reference Corpus of Medieval French project (SRCMF)

abstractContent.text: Then, we will show how the NotaBene RDF Annotation Tool software is used within the project (2).
In our conclusion, we will stress further developments of the tool (3).
